trans-unit.source: DSC File Resource
trans-unit.target: DSC File Resource

trans-unit.source: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0
trans-unit.target: Applies To: Windows PowerShell 4.0, Windows PowerShell 5.0

trans-unit.source: The File resource in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage files and folders on the target node.
trans-unit.target: The File resource in Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) provides a mechanism to manage files and folders on the target node.

trans-unit.source: Syntax
trans-unit.target: Syntax

trans-unit.source: Properties
trans-unit.target: Properties

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: DestinationPath
trans-unit.target: DestinationPath

trans-unit.source: Indicates the location where you want to ensure the state for a file or directory.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the location where you want to ensure the state for a file or directory.

trans-unit.source: Attributes
trans-unit.target: Attributes

trans-unit.source: Specifies the desired state of the attributes for the targeted file or directory.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the desired state of the attributes for the targeted file or directory.

trans-unit.source: Checksum
trans-unit.target: Checksum

trans-unit.source: Indicates the checksum type to use when determining whether two files are the same.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the checksum type to use when determining whether two files are the same.

trans-unit.source: If Checksum is not specified, only the file or directory name is used for comparison.
trans-unit.target: If Checksum is not specified, only the file or directory name is used for comparison.

trans-unit.source: Valid values include: SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-512, createdDate, modifiedDate.
trans-unit.target: Valid values include: SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-512, createdDate, modifiedDate.

trans-unit.source: Contents
trans-unit.target: Contents

trans-unit.source: Specifies the contents of a file, such as a particular string.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the contents of a file, such as a particular string.

trans-unit.source: Credential
trans-unit.target: Credential

trans-unit.source: Indicates the credentials that are required to access resources, such as source files, if such access is required.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the credentials that are required to access resources, such as source files, if such access is required.

trans-unit.source: Ensure
trans-unit.target: Ensure

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the file or directory exists.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the file or directory exists.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to "Absent" to ensure that the file or directory does not exist.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to "Absent" to ensure that the file or directory does not exist.

trans-unit.source: Set it to "Present" to ensure that the file or directory does exist.
trans-unit.target: Set it to "Present" to ensure that the file or directory does exist.

trans-unit.source: The default is "Present".
trans-unit.target: The default is "Present".

trans-unit.source: Force
trans-unit.target: Force

trans-unit.source: Certain file operations (such as overwriting a file or deleting a directory that is not empty) will result in an error.
trans-unit.target: Certain file operations (such as overwriting a file or deleting a directory that is not empty) will result in an error.

trans-unit.source: Using the Force property overrides such errors.
trans-unit.target: Using the Force property overrides such errors.

trans-unit.source: The default value is $false.
trans-unit.target: The default value is $false.

trans-unit.source: Recurse
trans-unit.target: Recurse

trans-unit.source: Indicates if subdirectories are included.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if subdirectories are included.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to $true to indicate that you want subdirectories to be included.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to $true to indicate that you want subdirectories to be included.

trans-unit.source: The default is $false.
trans-unit.target: The default is $false.

trans-unit.source: Note: This property is only valid when the Type property is set to Directory.
trans-unit.target: Note: This property is only valid when the Type property is set to Directory.

trans-unit.source: DependsOn
trans-unit.target: DependsOn

trans-unit.source: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that the configuration of another resource must run before this resource is configured.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is ResourceName and its type is ResourceType, the syntax for using this property is DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName".
trans-unit.target: For example, if the ID of the resource configuration script block that you want to run first is ResourceName and its type is ResourceType, the syntax for using this property is DependsOn = "[ResourceType]ResourceName".

trans-unit.source: SourcePath
trans-unit.target: SourcePath

trans-unit.source: Indicates the path from which to copy the file or folder resource.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the path from which to copy the file or folder resource.

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Indicates if the resource being configured is a directory or a file.
trans-unit.target: Indicates if the resource being configured is a directory or a file.

trans-unit.source: Set this property to "Directory" to indicate that the resource is a directory.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to "Directory" to indicate that the resource is a directory.

trans-unit.source: Set it to "File" to indicate that the resource is a file.
trans-unit.target: Set it to "File" to indicate that the resource is a file.

trans-unit.source: The default value is “File”.
trans-unit.target: The default value is “File”.

trans-unit.source: MatchSource
trans-unit.target: MatchSource

trans-unit.source: If set to the default value of $false, then any files on the source (say, files A, B, and C) will be added to the destination the first time the configuration is applied.
trans-unit.target: If set to the default value of $false, then any files on the source (say, files A, B, and C) will be added to the destination the first time the configuration is applied.

trans-unit.source: If a new file (D) is added to the source, it will not be added to the destination, even when the configuration is re-applied later.
trans-unit.target: If a new file (D) is added to the source, it will not be added to the destination, even when the configuration is re-applied later.

trans-unit.source: If the value is $true, then each time the configuration is applied, new files subsequently found on the source (such as file D in this example) are added to the destination.
trans-unit.target: If the value is $true, then each time the configuration is applied, new files subsequently found on the source (such as file D in this example) are added to the destination.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to use the File resource to ensure that a directory with the path C:\Users\Public\Documents\DSCDemo\DemoSource on a source computer (such as the “pull” server) is also present (along with all subdirectories) on the target node.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to use the File resource to ensure that a directory with the path C:\Users\Public\Documents\DSCDemo\DemoSource on a source computer (such as the “pull” server) is also present (along with all subdirectories) on the target node.

trans-unit.source: It also writes a confirmatory message to the log when complete and includes a statement to ensure that the file-checking operation runs prior to the logging operation.
trans-unit.target: It also writes a confirmatory message to the log when complete and includes a statement to ensure that the file-checking operation runs prior to the logging operation.
